list.name: Changes
list.comment: Added a page for users to check the review schedule. Added a column in Decks so users can check where each individual deck lies within the 2-week cycle. Added Homepage to be visible to logged-in users for education.

component.name: FlaskConsoleOptions
component.custom-start-script: import sys sys.path.extend([WORKING_DIR_AND_PYTHON_PATHS]) from flask.cli import ScriptInfo locals().update(ScriptInfo(create_app=None).load_app().make_shell_context()) print("Python %s on %s\nApp: %s [%s]\nInstance: %s" % (sys.version, sys.platform, app.import_name, app.env, app.instance_path))

option.name: myCustomStartScript
option.value: import sys sys.path.extend([WORKING_DIR_AND_PYTHON_PATHS]) from flask.cli import ScriptInfo locals().update(ScriptInfo(create_app=None).load_app().make_shell_context()) print("Python %s on %s\nApp: %s [%s]\nInstance: %s" % (sys.version, sys.platform, app.import_name, app.env, app.instance_path))

task.summary: Default task
Added database file to git tracking
Small adjustments to review scheduling, cards correctly reviewed in box 5 are removed from the review pool and can be considered "learned". Cards with next_review_date are learned cards.
Added comments to scheduling algorithm

Implemented a daily login streak, displayed on the user's dashboard, and created a script "generate_logins.py" to test this feature. Daily streak logic is inside the route for dashboard. Created and included in base.html a custom css file to make the streak badge (only slightly) more appealing

Implemented a points system, each User has a points attribute which is defaulted to 0. Upon succesful login, users are awarded 10 points, which is amplified by their current login streak. Streak logic has been relocated to the login route so users can be awarded an appropriate number of points immediately upon login
Added a new page, account_settings.html, which contains a button user's can click to delete their account. Changes made to models to facilitate this deletion, via cascading on deletion.
Utilised pytz to display most recent login according to BST on dashboard
Implemented achievement and user_achievement models, and a script to commit some basic achievements to the database. Users are awarded these basic achievements upon certain points thresholds
Added a "target" attribute to the achievement schema, to facilitate progress tracking. Also added a script to update the existing schema with the target column
Changed achievements page to display user's obtained achievements seperately to those that are incomplete. Progress bars are displayed for all.
Small changes to decks/routes and view_deck to ensure users cannot modify public decks that they do not own (have not shared themselves)
Commiting untracked migration
Small changes to presentation of achievements. Incomplete achievements will have progress feedback presented in black to show against the grey progress bar
Text will now become white once progress reaches a 50% threshold, to make it more readable against the green progress bar
Further stylistic changes to achievements, using a multicoloured progress bar so that text is visible over the complete and incomplete bar, with greyed out achievement badges.
Small changes to base.html to make the navbar more organised and concise, with several features listen under 'My Decks'. Users will only see Add Card if they own a deck to add to
Extended "styles.css" for easier changes to styling and colours, changed font to 'Inter' from Google Fonts

Improved the password creation process, requiring users to choose a password at least 8 characters in length. A progress bar provides feedback to users based on how secure their password is, upgraded by adding different character types and rewarding longer passwords. Passwords are also checked against a basic list of commonly used/ exposed passwords. A requirements.txt file has been provided for those looking to run the project in their own environment. Flask-Limited is used to lock users out after 5 failed login attempts per 5 minutes

Improved the review_summary.html page so that user's correct answer percentage is shown as a blue circular progress bar. Fixed a bug where refreshing the review_summary.html page would award the user with the points for that session every time the page was loaded, leading to infinite rewards. Added an extra required install to requirements.txt
Added date_created to decks.html to distinguish between similar decks. Changed date formats to UK standard.
Improved the login function to lock users out by using their unique login key generated using new function login_key
Adjustments made to failed login attempt limits (specific to user login_key) set in app\auth\routes.py
Further adjustments to failed login attempt limits, limiting by the minute AND by the hour
Small improvement to login view function so that users are notified of an incorrect password input for the given username
Improvements to homepage, educating users on the underlying theory motivating the application.
Further improvements to homepage layout, complete with screenshots of the application interface after logging in.

Improved passwords to check for 10,000 most commonly used passwords. Created a page to store fully learned cards and a new column in decks.html to match. Improved layout of decks. Small change to dashboard to ensure "day" apears instead of "days" for a streak of 1

Reset database. Added 3 new achievements.py centred around reviewing different cards (not repeat reviews). Changed formatting of date on Achievement earned on. Added utils.py to avoid circular imports.
Upgraded achievement badges with numbered labels on the icon

Upgraded aesthetics of several pages, with neater, bordered tables and cards and centrelised, padded headings. Also ensured users can launch review by clicking on the number of cards that are due for review in decks.html
Added files to facilitate web hosting via Render
Changed requirements to avoid local paths
Updated Flask-WTF version to avoid incompatibility issues

Added a page for users to check the review schedule. Added a column in Decks so users can check where each individual deck lies within the 2-week cycle. Added Homepage to be visible to logged-in users for education.
